text.0: uprisen is savitar this god to quicken priest who neglects not this most constant duty.
text.1: to the gods verily he gives rich treasure and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.
text.2: having gone up on high the god broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him.
text.3: even the waters bend them to his service even this wind rests in the circling region.
text.4: though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them e’en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going.
text.5: he hath checked e’en their haste who glide like serpents night closely followed savitars dominion.
text.6: what was spread out she weaves afresh reweaving the skilful leaves his labour halfcompleted.
text.7: he hath arisen from rest and parted seasons savitar hath approached god holyminded.
text.8: through various dwellings through entire existence spreads manifest the household light of agni.
text.9: the mother gives her son the goodliest portion and savitar hath sped to meet his summons.
text.10: he comes again unfolded fain for conquest at home was he the love of all things moving.
text.11: each man hath come leaving his evil doings after the godlike savitars commandment.
text.12: the wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters.
text.13: the woods are given to the birds these statutes of the god savitar none disobeyeth.
text.14: with utmost speed in restless haste at sunset varuṇa seeks his watery habitation.
text.15: then seeks each bird his nest each beast his lodging in due place savitar hath set each creature.
text.16: him whose high law not varuṇa nor indra not mitra aryaman nor rudra breaketh.
text.17: nor evilhearted fiends here for my welfare him i invoke god savitar with worship.
text.18: may they who strengthen bliss and thought and wisdom and the dames’ lord and narāśaṁsa aid us.
text.19: that good may come to us and wealth be gathered may we be savitar the gods beloved.
text.20: so come to us our hearts desire the bounty bestowed by thee from heaven and earth and waters.
text.21: that it be well with friends and those who praise thee and savitar with the loudlauding singer.
